snippet.title: Why Putin Will Fail
snippet.description: By reconnecting to the world, Russia has benefited greatly. By severing those ties, it will pay a dear price and ultimately collapse once again.

snippet.title: Beating Jet Lag: 8 Ways You're Doing It Wrong And How To Do It Right
snippet.description: From movies to cocktails and sleeping pills, those things you thought were helping you sleep in flight may actually worsen your jet lag. read »

snippet.title: Why Facebook Is Spending Billions On Companies It Doesn't Need
snippet.description: Why?! As the dust settles on Facebook’s $2BN purchase of virtual reality headset maker Oculus Rift last week this remains the question on everyone’s lips. What’s more it is the second time we’ve made this exclamation in as many months after Facebook spent a seemingly ludicrous amount of money ($19BN) on [...]

snippet.title: Why Leaders Are Poor Communicators
snippet.description: If you know a bad leader, chances are he or she is also a poor communicator. Here are the reasons why our leaders don't improve in communications -- even though we all know it's a critical part of the role. read »

snippet.title: When It's Time To Part With Family Heirlooms, And Why I Gave Away Grandpa Oscar's Violin
snippet.description: A donation to charity ends this 50-year family tradition: Child breaks violin. Grownup repairs it and preserves it for the next generation.

snippet.title: Icahn's Letter To Apple Leaves Out Some Key Points
snippet.description: Carl Icahn's letter to Apple left out key points about the amount of debt Apple would have to take on and how much profit an Apple TV could generate. read »

snippet.title: Why Is Adobe Stock Up So Much?
snippet.description: As a shareholder, it has not escaped my attention that Adobe Systems shares have soared in the past year. This leaves me with two questions: Why? Will they continue to rise? My guess is that shares have risen because of the success of Adobe's transition to software as a service [...] read »

snippet.title: Why Is The FDA Regulating Tobacco Products?
snippet.description: Did you know that the agency ensuring the safety and efficacy of drugs also regulates the sales of a product that kills 440,000 Americans annually? read »

snippet.title: Why The World Has A Stake In Ukraine
snippet.description: We have crucial interests at stake in Ukraine. If Vladimir Putin goes unopposed, he will continue to destabilize Europe. Failure to act now will only cause us bigger problems later. read »
